metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30661 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. Thisissue is fixed in Safari 14.1, iOS 12.5.3, iOS 14.5 and iPadOS 14.5,watchOS 7.4, tvOS 14.5, macOS Big Sur 11.3. Processing maliciously craftedweb content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of areport that this issue may have been actively exploited..

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30661` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
